  physical_appearance: The image shows a colour photograph. It consists of eight people. The front row contains three ladies and a female child. All of them are sitting down with their legs stretched
 on the grass ground. Behind them are four men who are all kneeling. The man on the right hand side of the photograph is wearing a pair of sunglasses. All of them are looking towards the direction where the photograph was taken.

metadata.title_text: Photograph of Herbert Lim, Mavis Chew and friends
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a colour photograph. It consists of eight people. The front row contains three ladies and a female child. All of them are sitting down with their legs stretched, on the grass ground. Behind them are four men who are all kneeling. The man on the right hand side of the photograph is wearing a pair of sunglasses. All of them are looking towards the direction where the photograph was taken.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Colour photography Picnics Portraits, Group Portrait photography
metadata.subject_terms_3: Lim, Herbie Eng Kwan Portrait photography
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a group sitting on a lawn. It is accompanied by captions ‘Picnic at Tanah Merah’ and ‘Paul, Sam, Samuel Dec, Self, Betty Loke, May, Frances Leong, Hilary. August 1953’.   

With continuous improvement of camera technology, it became possible to take photographs outside a studio in the first decades of the 20th century. Many middle-class families collected photographs in albums as a way of documenting family life, or documentasi keluarga.
